citation.article-title: Gaetbulicola byunsanensis gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from tidal flat sediment
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Gaetbulicola byunsanensis sp. nov.
Gaetbulicola byunsanensis (byun.san.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. byunsanensis of Byunsan, where the type strain was isolated).
Displays the following properties in addition to those given for the genus.
Cells are rod-, oval- or coccoid-shaped (1.0–3.0×1.5–15.0 μm).
Colonies on MA are circular, convex, smooth, pale yellow in colour and 0.7–1.0 mm in diameter after 7 days incubation at 25–30 °C.
Optimal growth occurs at 25–30 °C; growth occurs at 10 and 40 °C, but not at 4 or 41 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is 7.0–8.0; growth occurs at pH 5.5, but not at pH 5.0.
Optimal growth occurs in the presence of 2 % (w/v) NaCl; growth occurs in the presence of 5 % (w/v) NaCl, but not in the absence of NaCl or in the presence of more than 6 % (w/v) NaCl.
Aesculin, casein, gelatin, hypoxanthine, xanthine, starch, l-tyrosine and Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80 are not hydrolysed.
d-Xylose, acetate, l-malate, pyruvate and succinate are utilized; l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose and d-mannose are utilized weakly.
l-Glutamate, maltose, sucrose, salicin, trehalose, citrate, benzoate and formate are not utilized.

Susceptible to ampicillin (10 μg), carbenicillin (100 μg), cephalothin (30 μg), chloramphenicol (100 μg), gentamicin (30 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), neomycin (30 μg), novobiocin (5 μg), penicillin G (20 IU) and streptomycin (50 μg), but not to lincomycin (15 μg), oleandomycin (15 μg), polymyxin B (100 IU) or tetracycline (30 μg).

In assays with the API ZYM system, esterase (C4) and esterase lipase (C8) are present, but alkaline phosphatase, lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are not.
The type strain is SMK-114T (=KCTC 22632T =CCUG 57612T), isolated from tidal flat sediment of Byunsan of the Yellow Sea in Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 60.0 mol% (determined by HPLC).
